comments:
This sort of looks like possibly a class cast error occurs during the "recover" of another error? 

I started with eclipse platform M6, on linux, 
VM: 
java version "1.4.2_07"
Java(TM) 2 Runtime Environment, Standard Edition (build 1.4.2_07-b05)
Java HotSpot(TM) Client VM (build 1.4.2_07-b05, mixed mode)


from callisto site, I selected JST, and all its pre-reqs .. it actually seemed to have downloaded them all, but shortly after confirming "yes, install all unsigned jars", I got one of those vague "internal error occured", and this in the console log. I was using one of the mirrors ... forgot to note which one. 



!SESSION 2006-04-19 00:41:25.031 -----------------------------------------------

!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.jobs 4 2 2006-04-19 00:50:56.410
!MESSAGE An internal error occurred during: "Update Manager".
!STACK 0
java.lang.ClassCastException
        at org.eclipse.update.internal.core.SiteFileContentConsumer.abort(SiteFileContentConsumer.java:209)

        at org.eclipse.update.internal.ui.wizards.InstallWizard2$1.run(InstallWizard2.java:461)
        at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:58)

This is probably insightful ... on *subsequent* update attempt, from same mirror, I believe, same Eclipse session, I got the following exception in the log. 

Still vague error message -- gee, sure seems like a "503" could be handled a bit more friendly! 

I then tried to update from eclipse.org, and all was fine, so, ... 
this is really two bugs, please,  ... what's classcast about, and 
why can not a uesr freindly message be provided for ANY unexpected 
server response, expecially 
"503 Service Temporarily Unavailable"

class cast fixed. As for friendly message this is a problem through out update and it probably need more time then what is left for this release. It even might need some API changes in respect to exception handling in the update.

traces.message: Server returned HTTP response code: "503 Service Temporarily Unavailable" for URL: http://ftp.osu osl.org/pub/eclipse//callisto/releases/plugins/org.eclipse.emf.mapping.ecore2ecore.editor_2.2.0.v200604060931.jar.
